means: 踱步于，走动( pace的现在分词 )
调整自己的工作（或活动）节奏

sentence.Network_en: The pacing was uneven, and the early second act dragged.
sentence.Network_cn: 节奏忽快忽慢，第二幕前半场太过拖沓。

sentence.Network_en: He found John pacing around the flat, unable to sleep.
sentence.Network_cn: 他发现约翰在公寓里来回踱步，无法入睡。

entry.def: The pace of something is the speed at which it happens or is done.

example.ex: Many people were not satisfied with the pace of change.
example.tran: 很多人对变革的步伐不满意。

example.ex: ...people who prefer to live at a slower pace...
example.tran: 乐于放慢生活节奏的人

entry.def: Your pace is the speed at which you walk.

example.ex: He moved at a brisk pace down the rue St Antoine...
example.tran: 他沿着圣安托万街轻快地走去。

example.ex: Their pace quickened as they approached their cars.
example.tran: 走近自己的车时，他们加快了脚步。

entry.def: A pace is the distance that you move when you take one step.

example.ex: He'd only gone a few paces before he stopped again...
example.tran: 他只走了几步远就又停了下来。

entry.tran: （由于焦虑或不耐烦而）在…踱步
entry.def: If you pace a small area, you keep walking up and down it, because you are anxious or impatient.

example.ex: As they waited, Kravis paced the room nervously...
example.tran: 他们等的时候，克拉维斯在屋里不安地踱来踱去。

example.ex: He found John pacing around the flat, unable to sleep...
example.tran: 他发现约翰在公寓里来回踱步，无法入睡。

entry.def: If you pace yourself when doing something, you do it at a steady rate.

example.ex: It was a tough race and I had to pace myself.
example.tran: 这是场艰苦的比赛，我不得不控制好节奏。

entry.def: If something keeps pace with something else that is changing, it changes quickly in response to it.

example.ex: Farmers are angry because the rise fails to keep pace with inflation.
example.tran: 农民们很气愤，因为提价赶不上通货膨胀。

example.ex: ...a world changing far too fast for her to keep pace.
example.tran: 世界变化得太快，她跟不上

entry.tran: 与…齐头并进（或并驾齐驱）
entry.def: If you keep pace with someone who is walking or running, you succeed in going as fast as them, so that you remain close to them.

example.ex: With four laps to go, he kept pace with the leaders...
example.tran: 还剩4圈的时候，他紧紧咬住领先者。

example.ex: Daisy strode alongside her, breathing heavily but keeping pace.
example.tran: 黛西在她身边大步走着，大口喘着气，但是没有落后。

entry.def: If you do something at your own pace , you do it at a speed that is comfortable for you.

example.ex: The computer will give students the opportunity to learn at their own pace...
example.tran: 计算机让学生们有机会按照自己的节奏学习。

example.ex: She was going too fast so I decided to keep riding at my own pace.
example.tran: 她骑得太快了，所以我决定按自己的速度骑。

entry.tran: 考查…的能力/ 展现…的才能
entry.def: If you put someone through their paces or make them go through their paces, you get them to show you how well they can do something.

example.ex: The British coach is putting the boxers through their paces...
example.tran: 英国教练正在检验拳手们的能力。

example.ex: A group of the world's best waterskiers will be going through their paces.
example.tran: 一队世界上最优秀的滑水运动员将一展身手。

means.word_mean: 1. (music) the speed at which a composition is to be played

auth_sentence.content: There's a very measured pacing of aural incidents.
auth_sentence.res_content: There's a very measured pacing of aural incidents.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's a very measured pacing of aural incidents.

auth_sentence.content: Pacing is another of this short album's strengths.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pacing is another of this short album's strengths.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pacing is another of this short album's strengths.

auth_sentence.content: From my sickbed, I could hear them pacing.
auth_sentence.res_content: From my sickbed, I could hear them pacing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: From my sickbed, I could hear them pacing.
